items.sentence: Tom isn't eating a sandwich. He's eating a taco.
I know Tom. That's the reason I don't trust him.
Tom ran away with tears streaming down his face.
Tom couldn't help but chuckle at Mary's comment.
Tom won't listen, not after what you did to him.
Tom and Mary reminisced about the good old days.
My six-year-old has just started primary school.
I don't want spaghetti for dinner. I want pizza.
I've been told that you're looking for a sitter.
I didn't know Tom and Mary were French speakers.
Neither Tom nor Mary are answering their phones.
We don't get many opportunities to speak French.
If you don't want to help me, you don't have to.
Are you sure you don't need to help Tom do that?
You're not watching that garbage again, are you?
Tom said that he thought Mary understood French.
Tom said that he thought that Mary spoke French.
Tom said that he thought he should study French.
Tom said that he thought he had to study French.
Tom said that he thought he had to speak French.
